response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to require that pharmacy technicians be registered with and obtain a certificate of registration issued by the Board of Pharmacy, beginning January 1, 2026. [CHUNK_65] The bill imposes a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations by registered pharmacy technicians to the Board of Pharmacy. [CHUNK_66] It also specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns. [CHUNK_66]",
  "appropriations": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any specific appropriations for this measure. [CHUNK_0] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by deleting the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] The bill does not specify any intended uses for funding. [CHUNK_1]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided documents do not contain financial projections or a detailed cost estimation methodology. [CHUNK_0] The bill establishes that any person who violates the provisions of the chapter shall be fined no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2] However, there is no methodology provided to estimate the revenue from these fines. [CHUNK_57]",
  "agency_impact": "The Board of Pharmacy will be required to issue certificates of registration for registered pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_17] A new duty is imposed on the pharmacist-in-charge to notify the board, in writing, if a registered pharmacy technician is suspected to have violated any law or rule regarding the practice of pharmacy. [CHUNK_6] The board may also deny, revoke, or suspend any registration for causes including professional misconduct or violation of federal or state drug laws. [CHUNK_50]",
  "economic_impact": "This measure establishes financial penalties for non-compliance. [CHUNK_56] Any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter or the rules adopted pursuant to this chapter shall be fined no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2] The documents do not specify any other direct economic impacts, cost savings, or benefits to the community. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure amends Chapter 461, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish a registration requirement for pharmacy technicians, which did not previously exist. [CHUNK_1] It specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_4] The bill also clarifies that the supervising registered pharmacist shall supervise the actions of the pharmacy intern. [CHUNK_33]",
  "revenue_sources": "This measure has been amended to delete the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians, removing a potential source of revenue. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] The only potential revenue source identified in the bill is from disciplinary fines. [CHUNK_56] These fines shall be no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided documents do not include a six-year fiscal projection. [CHUNK_0] A previous funding mechanism has been removed by deleting the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] This change eliminates a recurring revenue stream that would have supported the program. [CHUNK_67] A new, but variable, revenue stream is created through fines for violations. [CHUNK_56] Any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be fined no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2] The number of registrants and potential violations is unknown, so future revenue cannot be projected. [CHUNK_1] Certificates of registration will be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year, indicating a biennial renewal cycle, but without a fee. [CHUNK_2] The administrative costs to the Board of Pharmacy for managing the registration and renewal process are not specified. [CHUNK_17] The bill does not mention any changes to staffing levels. [CHUNK_9] The long-term fiscal sustainability of the program without a dedicated funding source is not addressed. [CHUNK_67]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The measure will have a mixed impact on operating revenues. [CHUNK_56] A potential, recurring revenue stream was eliminated by deleting the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] However, the bill creates a new, albeit unpredictable, source of revenue by establishing fines of no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation of the chapter. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not indicate any capital expenditures are required for this measure. [CHUNK_0] No investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure are mentioned in the bill. [CHUNK_11] The purpose of the measure is to establish a regulatory system for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_59]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided documents do not specify any ongoing fiscal obligations after a six-year period. [CHUNK_0] The registration program for pharmacy technicians is permanent, but with the deletion of the registration fee, there is no specified recurring funding source to cover long-term administrative costs. [CHUNK_66] Potential revenue from fines is unpredictable and may not be sufficient to sustain the program. [CHUNK_56]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The primary update from the previous fiscal note is the change in the measure's funding mechanism and effective date. [CHUNK_66] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by deleting the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] The measure now includes a provision that any person who violates the chapter shall be fined no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation, which was not previously specified. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2] Additionally, the committee changed its effective date to upon approval, replacing the previous placeholder date. [CHUNK_67]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided legislative documents for H.B. 72, C.D. 1 do not specify the addition or modification of any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions. [CHUNK_0] There is no mention of new staffing required by the Board of Pharmacy to implement or manage the new registration program. [CHUNK_17] The bill's focus is on establishing the regulatory requirements for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_59]",
  "appropriations_changes": "Consistent with the previous version, the current bill does not contain any appropriations. [CHUNK_0] A significant change is that a potential funding mechanism has been explicitly removed. [CHUNK_66] The Committee on Conference amended the measure by deleting the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "There is a significant change in funding sources from what was previously considered. [CHUNK_66] The Committee on Conference has deleted the $20 (HB72_CD1_CCR182_.htm.txt) registration fee for pharmacy technicians, which removes a key funding source. [CHUNK_66, NUMBER_0] The bill now establishes a new potential revenue source through fines, stating that any person who violates the chapter shall be fined no less than $100 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) and no more than $1,000 (HB72_CD1_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_56, NUMBER_1, NUMBER_2]",
  "department_impact": "The impacted department remains the same as in the previous version. [CHUNK_17] The Board of Pharmacy, under the Department of Commerce and Consumer Affairs, is responsible for issuing certificates of registration for registered pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_17] The board is also responsible for disciplinary actions, including denying, revoking, or suspending any registration. [CHUNK_50]",
  "reports_required": "The bill requires pharmacists-in-charge to report certain violations to the Board of Pharmacy. [CHUNK_66] If a registered pharmacy technician is suspected to have violated any law or rule regarding the practice of pharmacy, legend drugs, or controlled substances, the pharmacist-in-charge shall notify the board in writing. [CHUNK_6] The documents do not specify any new reports to be submitted to the legislature. [CHUNK_0]",
  "pilot_program": "This measure does not create a pilot program. [CHUNK_1] It establishes a permanent requirement that, beginning January 1, 2026, no person shall act as a pharmacy technician without first obtaining a valid certificate of registration. [CHUNK_1] The bill does state that the Board of Pharmacy may approve pilot and demonstration research projects for innovative applications in the practice of pharmacy. [CHUNK_22]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill. [CHUNK_58] Section 26H-6, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the repeal of professional and vocational regulatory boards and commissions, shall not apply to this Act. [CHUNK_58]",
  "effective_date": "The effective date has been changed from a previous placeholder date. [CHUNK_67] The Conference Committee amended this measure by changing its effective date to upon approval. [CHUNK_67] Section 11 of the bill states, \"This Act shall take effect upon its approval.\" [CHUNK_59]"
}

BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. Chapter 461, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by

SECTION 1. Chapter 461, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to be appropriately designated and to read as follows: " §461- Registered pharmacy technicians; certificate of registration required. (a) Beginning January 1, 2026, no person shall act as a pharmacy technician without first obtaining a valid

act as a pharmacy technician without first obtaining a valid certificate of registration issued by the board pursuant to this section. (b) Each certificate of registration shall be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year, upon which the registration shall lapse and a new registration shall be required. (c)

shall lapse and a new registration shall be required. (c) Beginning January 1, 2026, a pharmacy shall only employ registered pharmacy technicians to perform pharmacy technician duties. The pharmacist-in-charge shall verify that the person is a registered pharmacy technician and that the board has issued a certificate of registration for

that the board has issued a certificate of registration for the pharmacy technician before the registered pharmacy technician performs any tasks identified in this chapter or rules adopted pursuant to this chapter. The supervising registered pharmacist shall be responsible for the actions of the registered pharmacy technician. (d) The certificate

the actions of the registered pharmacy technician. overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fisacl not. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fisacl note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.
